visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a column chart with the following specifications: Chart type: column, Chart title: 'Winter Olympic medals per existing country (TOP 5)', Axes and labels styling: Labels and titles should have a font size of 13px, Custom colors: ['#FFD700', '#C0C0C0', '#CD7F32'], Data series: Three series with names 'Gold medals', 'Silver medals', and 'Bronze medals' and corresponding data, Additional configurations: The chart should be inverted and polar, with a pane size of 85% and inner size of 20%, and an end angle of 270 degrees.

title.text: Winter Olympic medals per existing country (TOP 5)

visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a polar column chart that is inverted. The chart displays the number of winter Olympic medals for the top 5 countries, categorized by gold, silver, and bronze medals. The chart uses custom colors for each medal type and includes a title describing the data. The x-axis labels are styled with a font size of 13px and include country flags for visual identification. The y-axis is configured to show the number of medals with a crosshair for better readability. The plot options for the columns include stacking and padding settings to ensure the data is presented clearly. The chart also includes accessibility features to enhance usability for all users.
